Key Arguments: The legislation is compared to censorship practices in communist China.
The bill is perceived as a threat to democracy, society, and economy.
The author feels their safety and wellbeing would be threatened by the bill.
The document is seen as propaganda for government control over social media.
Censorship during the COVID-19 era is cited as an example of government overreach.
Main Themes: Threats to democracy and personal freedom
Distrust in government narratives and actions
Notable Quotes: This almost feels like we’re going down the route of communist China, censoring it’s people...
The way you have worded this document smacks of propaganda...
You are treating your citizens as if we don’t see beyond this censorship...
